name: OpenAI and Amazon partnership
title: OpenAI and Amazon announce strategic partnership
body: On February 27, 2026, OpenAI and Amazon announced a multi-year strategic partnership. Amazon Web Services and OpenAI said they will co-create a Stateful Runtime Environment powered by OpenAI models, available on Amazon Bedrock for AWS customers building generative AI applications and agents at production scale. AWS will become the exclusive third-party cloud distribution provider for OpenAI Frontier, a platform for building, deploying, and managing teams of AI agents. OpenAI also said it will consume 2 gigawatts of Trainium capacity through AWS infrastructure, and Amazon said it will invest 50 billion dollars in OpenAI.

name: Anthropic acquires Vercept
title: Anthropic acquires Vercept to advance Claude's computer use capabilities
body: On February 25, 2026, Anthropic announced that it acquired Vercept. Anthropic said the goal is to improve Claude's computer use capabilities so the model can handle more complex tasks inside live applications, such as writing and running code across repositories, synthesizing research from many sources, and managing workflows across tools. Anthropic framed computer use as a way for Claude to act inside the same software humans use, not just answer in chat. The Vercept team includes researchers focused on perception and interaction problems that matter when AI systems need to see and act inside software.

name: Meta builds AI infrastructure with NVIDIA
title: Meta builds AI infrastructure with NVIDIA
body: On February 17, 2026, NVIDIA announced a multiyear strategic partnership with Meta covering AI infrastructure. NVIDIA said Meta will deploy NVIDIA CPUs, networking, and millions of Blackwell and Rubin GPUs as part of hyperscale data centers optimized for training and inference. The companies also highlighted better performance per watt, expansion of Spectrum-X Ethernet, and broader use of confidential computing to protect user privacy. NVIDIA and Meta said the deeper codesign work is meant to support Meta's long-term AI roadmap and new AI capabilities used by billions of people.
